Despu√©s de m√°s de 1000 horas en battle.net, no te podr√≠a decir con facilidad si este juego es recomendable o no, le doy que s√≠ lo es porque no deja de ser un juego entretenido al final de todo.

El juego tiene una gran variedad de personajes, cada uno con su propia arma y set de habilidades, lo que hace √∫nica la experiencia con cada uno de ellos, y afortunadamente puedes encontrar gu√≠as de cada personaje, o streamers que "mainean" a cualquier personaje, as√≠ que aprender a usar cada personaje no es problema, lo dem√°s es solo practicar.
Los modos principales de juego incitan al enfrentamiento en cada momento, siempre hay un objetivo que disputar con el equipo rival, as√≠ que la acci√≥n es fren√©tica hasta que te matan.

Los problemas vienen con todo lo que viene fuera del juego en s√≠:
-Un matchmaking del asco, as√≠ como te puedes encontrar con un jugador que no mata un elefante frente a √©l, como otro que carrea con una gran facilidad a su equipo.
-Cosm√©ticos muy caros.
-Un modo historia que se tiene que comprar.
-Un balance que parece salido del * de los programadores.

Con pros y contras, lo mejor es que pruebes el juego por ti mism@ y te hagas de tu propia opini√≥n, aprovechando que es gratuito.
Paladins √ß√∂p√ºn√ºn orijinali. Halihazƒ±rda oyunun T√ºrk√ße dil desteƒüi varken Steam versiyonunda neden yok? Blizzard bu ve bundan ayrƒ± bir√ßok hatasƒ±yla kendini bitiriyor..

[h1] This review is in spanish and english/ Esta rese√±a esta tanto en espa√±ol como en ingles. [/h1] 

[u] [b] Espa√±ol: [/b] [/u]  Hola y buenas, ac√° una jugadora veterana de OW con m√°s de mil horas. Vamos a empezar con lo primero: Activision-Blizzard. El principal problema de OW no es el juego en si sino la compa√±√≠a que est√° detr√°s que de alguna manera se las ingenian para convertir uno de los shooters mejor logrados en algo que ni siquiera es la sombra de lo que alguna vez fue. Para que se den una idea de que tan mal est√°n las cosas empiezo con el sistema de monetizaci√≥n; todos odiamos las Lootboxes, yo las odio, vos las odias, todos; Bueno ¬øqu√© pasar√≠a si te dijera que aquel sistema tan odiado era mil veces mejor que el sistema de monetizaci√≥n actual? Antes, en OW1 m√°s all√° del competitivo y mejorar de rango, el objetivo principal eran los cosm√©ticos y si bien estaban las lootboxes estas se consegu√≠an jugando y subiendo de nivel, y aunque el contenido era al azar, tambi√©n exist√≠a una moneda interna completamente gratuita que te permit√≠a comprar lo que espec√≠ficamente quer√≠as, ahora, con el F2P, los cosm√©ticos cuestan una fortuna y no valen la pena, lo √∫nico que dentro de todo es aceptable y lo han hecho medianamente bien es el pase de batalla pero no mucho m√°s. 
Eso es por un lado, por el otro el matchmaking es DESASTROSO. Ganas 5 partidas seguidas y luego jugas 10 en donde tus compa√±eros parecen bots, y no son dos equipos jugando llenos de bots, no, es TU equipo el que tiene cada mog√≥lico que no podes creer lo mal que juegan. Todos tenemos malas partidas y manqueadas, pero ya cuando tu dps (rol de da√±o) va 0/0/7 y el dps enemigo va 23/7/3 y es as√≠ por cinco partidas seguidas es imposible no darse cuenta que hay algo que esta pasando que no tiene sentido. Al menos el balanceo esta muy bien logrado, los primeros meses se notaba que hacia falta balances pero ahora es mucho mejor (puede variar un poco cuando agregan un h√©roe o un mapa nuevo), viniendo de OW1 y de la oscura √©poca del GOATS y Brigitte estoy m√°s que satisfecha. 
Es impresionante lo mal manejado que esta este juego, casi que parece una broma o un acto masoquista de Blizzard, porque el problema no es el equipo de desarrollo de OW que realmente si se han preocupado por el juego (por ejemplo, cuando salieron a la luz los abusos sexuales y explotaci√≥n laboral de Activision-Blizzard, Jeff Kaplan, antiguo director de OW, defendi√≥ a sus trabajadores y como resultado fue echado), sino que la culpa esta en los de arriba que no les importa una mierda. Este juego no es una secuela ni en broma, y hasta tardo en meses en poder decir que fue una "actualizaci√≥n gigante". Es una verdadera lastima el estado actual del manejo del juego porque OW tenia absolutamente todo para triunfar y estar en la cima de los juegos multijugador: Excelente arte, mundo, personajes, lore, m√∫sica, gameplay y mucho m√°s y de alguna manera se las ingeniaron para manejar todo como el orto. Existe una muy m√≠nima posibilidad de que Microsoft haga algo y para bien, pero yo por el momento no contar√≠a con eso. Me alegro que el juego haya salido para steam ya que lo necesitaba y SIN EL LAUNCHER. Si recomiendo jugarlo, es un juego totalmente √∫nico. Team Fortress 2, Paladins y Overwatch son tres juegos totalmente distintos, juego a los tres as√≠ que podes confiar en mi cuando te digo que no hay un shooter como Overwatch en el mercado actualmente, eso lo podes tomar como algo bueno o malo. Mi rese√±a negativa va para Activision-Blizzard, que mucho no va a servir, pero por fin despu√©s de tantos a√±os tanto yo, como muchos otros jugadores de Overwatch que amamos este juego, podemos por fin hacer una rese√±a y expresar nuestra opini√≥n. 
Una ultima cosa: NO COMPRES NINGUNA EDICI√ìN DEL JUEGO. Absolutamente todos los h√©roes se pueden desbloquear jugando, incluso los m√°s nuevos, y si bien dije que est√° todo monetizado, hay una moneda gratis que se puede conseguir gratuitamente y te permite comprar cosm√©ticos de Overwatch 1. ¬øY el modo historia? Ni loca, tampoco lo compres, no lo jugu√© ni se si esta bueno o no, pero es simplemente protesta.  

[u] [b] English: [/b] [/u] (Sorry if my english is bad) Hello, here a veteran OW player with more than a thousand hours. Let's start with the first: Activision-Blizzard. The main problem with OW is not the game itself, is the company behind it that somehow manages to turn one of the most accomplished shooters into something that isn't even a shadow of what it once was. To give you an idea of ‚Äã‚Äãhow bad things are, I start with the monetization system; We all hate Lootboxes, I hate them, you hate them, everyone; Well, what would happen if a told you that this hated system was a thousand times better than the current monetization system? Before in OW1, beyond the competitive and rank improvement, the main objective was cosmetics and although there were lootboxes, these were achieved by playing and leveling up, and although the content was random, there was also a completely free internal currency that It allowed you to buy what you specifically wanted, now, with F2P, cosmetics cost a fortune and are not worth it, the only thing that is acceptable and they have done it fairly well is the battle pass but not much else.
That's on the one hand, on the other the matchmaking is DISASTROUS. You win 5 games in a row and then you play 10 matches where your teammates look like bots, and it's not two teams playing full of bots, no, it's YOUR team that has every idiot you can't believe how bad they play. We all have bad games and make mistakes, but when your dps (damage roll) goes 0/0/7 and the enemy dps goes 23/7/3 and it's like that for five games in a row, it's impossible not to realize that something makes no sense. At least the balance is very well achieved, the first few months it was noticeable that balance was needed but now it's better (it may vary a bit when they add a hero or a new map), and coming from OW1 and the dark era of GOATS and Brigitte I'm more than satisfied.
It is impressive how poorly managed this game is, it almost seems like a joke or a masochistic act by Blizzard, because the problem is not the OW development team that really did care about the game (for example, when they went out to the light the sexual abuse and labor exploitation of Activision-Blizzard, Jeff Kaplan, former director of OW, defended his workers and was fired as a result), but the blame lies with those above who don't give a shit. This game is not a sequel by any means and it took months even to be able to say that it was a "giant update". The current state of game management is a real shame because OW had absolutely everything to succeed and be at the top of multiplayer games: Excellent art, world, characters, lore, music, gameplay and much more and somehow they managed to handle everything like shit. There is a very slim chance that Microsoft will do something for good, but I wouldn't count on that at the moment. I am glad that the game has come out for steam since it was needed and WITHOUT THE LAUNCHER. Yes, I recommend playing it, it is a totally unique game. Team Fortress 2, Paladins and Overwatch are three totally different games, I play all three so you can trust me when I tell you there isn't a shooter like Overwatch on the market right now, you can take that as a good or a bad thing. My negative review goes to Activision-Blizzard, which is not going to help much, but after so many years, I, like many other Overwatch players who love this game, can finally review and express our opinion.
One last thing: DO NOT BUY ANY EDITION OF THE GAME. Absolutely all heroes can be unlocked by playing, even the newest ones, and although I said that everything is monetized, there is a free currency that can be obtained for free and allows you to buy Overwatch 1 cosmetics. And the story mode? Not crazy, don't buy it either, I didn't play it and I don't know if it's good or not, but it's just a protest.
how come this doesn't run on my all in one from walmart

BRING OVERWATCH 1 BACK!

I honestly bought the game many years ago on the battlenet, I really liked how the game developed under the direction of Jeff Kaplan. It was my favorite online game that I played over 1500 hours. And then they took away the purchased game from me and instead put this "misunderstanding" into which it is impossible to play, everything is so broken and very bad. The game has become much, much worse in every aspect, from design and style to game mechanics. Just awful. Spoiled mood. Besides, I —Åan`t even play properly. On my computer, where I calmly play The Witcher 3 and GTA 5, Overwatch 2 is wildly slow, it's impossible to play: Friezes, brakes, lags, although the first part played perfectly.

I hate what you turned my favorite game into. Just take it all back. Or run a separate Overwatch 1 server. After all, I once paid money for this.

Ich spiele Overwatch schon eine ganze Weile und habe schon viele h√∂hen und tiefen dieses Games miterlebt.
Das Spiel selbst l√§uft prima. Das technische Ger√ºst ist sehr stabil.
Die Community kann ziemlich toxisch sein was einem den Feierabend vermiesen kann, aber durch das deaktivieren des Match Chats in den Optionen hat man schnell wieder Ruhe.

Overwatch 2 ver√§nderte ein wenig am Spiel und hat das 6v6 auf 5v5 gek√ºrzt. Ein Tank Slot wurde entfernt und die Rolle wurde √ºberarbeitet, sodass Tanks nun ein wichtiges Bollwerk auf dem Weg zum Sieg sind.
Desweiteren strich man das Lootbox System aus Overwatch 1 (welches √ºbrigens fair und akzeptiert war) und brachte den Cash Shop und Battlepass.

Aber das Hauptargument f√ºr die "2" in Overwatch war die versprochene Koop-PvE-Kampagne mit Hero- und Storymissionen. F√ºr den Fall das es jemanden entgangen sein sollte: Es wurde gestrichen... no joke.
Die Hero Missionen wurden vollends verworfen und man wirft uns nun die Story Missionen zum fra√ü vor welche nur die wenigsten interessieren. Hero Missionen waren der shit den wir wollten. Wem die Story Missionen interessieren muss sie √ºbrigens kaufen. Das F2P Modell von Overwatch reicht wohl nur ins Men√º und PvP.

Eigentlich m√∂chte ich dem Spiel wegen der katastrophalen Monetarisierung auch einen Daumen nach unten geben, w√§re da nicht das Spiel selbst. Overwatch ist im Kern immer noch ein guter Heldenshooter. Und wenn man noch ein paar Freunde zusammentrommelt wird es gleich noch besser.

And you gotta play real matches instead of just fighting bots to make any progress like what?

And as far as I know there isn't a easy way to get points without paying like what?

Way to ruin my favorite of all time.


You know, Blizzard. If you actually made it so that the main goal was to increase player enjoyability and fun factor, instead of cash. You'd actually earn MORE cash in the long run AND have community respect?
Every new hero is OP, no lootboxes, PvE cancelled. Here you go, a short review for Overwatch 2. Bring back the old game

[b]Biased review from an OG Overwatch 1 player since release 2016![/b]

Overwatch is a great franchise! The lore behind the characters, the effort and emotions in the Cinematics, Animations and Shorts is top notch! Sometimes I couldn't even withhold a little tear.
The original Overwatch had its controversy when implementing Lootboxes - which were considered gambling and evil. But in retrospect to Overwatch 2 they were great! 
The player got a free Lootbox every level up and later 3 free boxes for playing Arcade. At special occasions we even got free boxes with guaranteed legendary skins in it! 
It was a full price game at the beginning but offered a lot of sales with reduced prices to grab it. And you could earn every Skin, Spray, Emote in game by playing the game. No greedy shop with limited time frames. No battle pass, no pressure.
Sure, the game had problems at times (Goats, Boats etc..) but they got addressed and fixed. It was a simple but happy life. At some point you could have unlocked everything and if something new came out, you had enough Credits to buy it with no effort at all.

My wife even gifted me 2 T-Shirts, Lego Wreckingball and a Torb Minifigure over the years of playing OW1.

Then Overwatch 2 was announced. The promise by Blizzard was to deliver a giant Story Mode with replayability, Hero Progression and Talents which could not be done in the original Engine of Overwatch.

Years passed. Overwatch 1 received fewer and fewer updates and was left alone under the illusion of development of OW2.
Then October 2022 came. Overwatch 2 released. It was an exciting experience at first. The promised PVE Story Mode was not in the game "yet". Blizzard said the PVP is the beta for the final Game.

Well. Guess what was in the Game instead. A heavy microtransaction shop where you had to grind for almost a year to buy at least one legendary skin. Everything was / is so overpriced with randomly and arbitrary picked reduced sales like "Oh this bundle costs 30% less in comparison so instead of 30‚Ç¨ its just 20‚Ç¨" For a f***ing skin bundle?! In comparison to what?

But not only the shop is terrible. The Battlepass was proclaimed the worst in gaming until this point! Total crap on the free tiers. Everything good was locked behind the premium tier for 1k Coins (10‚Ç¨). Battlepasses per se are the stupidest thing ever. "Let me pay you xx‚Ç¨ so that I'm forced to play only your game and earn rewards and if I don't have enough time to finish it then f*ck it, the good rewards are gone." And the players fall for it! I guess I'm too old for this nonsense to understand. 
I get that they need money for server upkeep and development. But it worked on all games before and from other studios as well without this crap?

[b]Let's continue the bad things, shall we?[/b]
They removed Maps and Gamemodes. Some Characters got locked because they were broken (fixed later). Matchmaking and rankingsystem broken. No "On-Fire"-System. No Reward-Cards at the end. No stay in Group after a match. And so on.... Some of these things got added now but should have been there from the beginning!

Blizzard took away OW1 from the players and forced us to play OW2 instead. As a compensation we received Legacy Credits. Woah how generous one might think. NO! You couldn't even buy the new stuff in the shop with these credits. Only Cosmetics from the original game. We couldn't pay the Battlepass with these, because you need the Premium Currency Credits for it. Well in some games you earn this currency by playing or in the Battlepass itself. 50% true. You can play and earn - but so little you had to grind for months to buy one Battlepass, but then you couldn't buy anything else in the store. And Currency in the BP was added later, but guess what - it is another Currency you can just buy crap with in the Store! 

I played through the first Season without spending a Cent on the game and then quit and uninstalled with a saddened heart. Even unsubbed all social media.

Some Seasons have passed. New Heroes were added to the game. Locked in the Battlepass (free Tier at least) but you are still at a disadvantage if you don't pay for it because you have to grind levels for weeks. If you missed the Battlepass for this hero you can unlock him/her/it by winning only 35 Matches as their role or mixed + some challenges in the training area OR just spend 900 Coins in the Shop to ‚Äúearn‚Äù him/her/it directly. What a joke in a hero shooter where reacting on your opponents team is crucial! Unbelievable! 

Then the big announcement from Blizzard. The PVE Story Mode is canceled. They stopped development of it way before the "Release" of the PVP "Beta" came out in October 2022. They knew all the time they couldn't make it and did not have the decency to tell the players. What. A. Scam!
They killed OW1 under the premise of this one big thing. So what was the reason in the first place then? The god damn Shop and Battlepass System. They could not implement this in OW1 so they had to redevelop a sequel game to wrap it around money making. That's all. 
All the missing Features like "On Fire" were gone although OW1 already had them in.
Oh yeah, the big cool story is gone but Blizzard announced their even better "Invasion": 15‚Ç¨ for limited time 3 Missions with 0 replayability. And next year there will be 3 more Missions coming for another 15‚Ç¨.

It is NOT Overwatch 2.0 - it is at best an Overwatch 1.2! Or an Overwatch Reforged - and we all know how good the Reforged is at Blizzard.

Don't get me wrong here. Overwatch is a fantastic hero shooter in an amazing universe with story/backgrounds/lore and if you are into it then play the game - it is free at least. 
BUT I beg you: Don't spend a single Cent/Penny/whatever to support this company any longer. Sure the Dev/Artist-Teams need and deserve the money, but it will end up in the greediest management. And the more players pay the more the management thinks it's okay to infest our beloved games with these abominations.
Please resist the urge to have the newest, coolest, lewdest Skins. Thanks.

I will have a look into the steam version, just to see what changed. But at times of Larian Studios "Baldurs Gate 3" Blizzard just moved even further in the "Bad Company which releases zero effort games with tons of mtx"-corner in my mind. I even resisted on buying Diablo 4 because of OW2 even though I love that franchise as well.

[h1]TLDR[/h1]:
+ Overwatch great IP with lore behind it
+ fun and free hero shooter
- Blizzard lied and scammed original OW1 players
- worst Battlepass in existence - no premium currency and not self-sustaining
- greedy shop with exorbitant prices
- little to none rewards for free players
- confusing currencies
- Promised PVE Story Mode with talents and progression canceled before release but only told after months after release
- locked heroes in Battlepass
- In OW1 you could earn every cosmetic by playing, in OW2 just by paying
* I quit right after season 1's end but will take a last look in the steam release

Uno de los juegos en multijugador mas abortivo, absurdo y desbalanceado que he tenido la desgracia de jugar. 

El matchmaking mas roto que el culo de mbappe, con apenas 20 horas me meten a partidas casuales con mamones de mas de 1300 horas o mas. haci√©ndolo solamente una experiencia miserable, pero cuidado que si te llegas a salir de una partida CASUAL, te penaliza con nada mas ni nada menos que -75% xp en tus pr√≥ximas partidas, felicidades blizzard hiciste que un mal momento, se convirtiera en un motivador para meterle una patada ninja a un brasilero y escupirle en la nuca a un peruano por la calle. Intentando jugar competitivo esta situaci√≥n no cambia apenas rankeando en oro van y me tiran a 3 bobitos rango maestro en el equipo enemigo, un poco de matchmaking te pido por favor.

Algunos personajes no son ni divertidos ni √∫tiles, sacan a un personaje NUEVO Lifeweaver el personaje mas in√∫til jamas creado. Luegon estan los bugs que dejan fuera a los putisim0s pjs por bugs, por casi un mes de duraci√≥n. primero Bastion con un error muy roto que permit√≠a lanzar ultimates infinitas durante el tiempo que dure el lanzamiento de esta y luego Mei despareciendo como mexicano, solo subi√©ndose al muro de hielo en una habitaci√≥n con techo bajo,

Precios excesivos y pases de batalla mas aburridos y sin chiste. se supone que siguen una tem√°tica pero en realidad parece que metieran cualquier skin random que tengan hecha, y no este tan buena como para que paguen 20 dolares pero decente como para que no parezca una basura vomitada. La forma de farmear moneditas esta cool para los f2p con mucho tiempo extra pero es un farmeo de misiones aburridas de horas cada semana, por solo 60 moneditas todas meadas, y para un pase de batalla que ni siquiera es bueno necesitas 1000 monedas.

Afortunadamente no me toco mandarme solo tremenda mierda, con panitas hay algunas partidas divertidas pero es lo m√≠nimo que se le pide a un juego que tengas algo de diversi√≥n, pero si jugas solo olv√≠date de divertirte es una experiencia que solo es deprimente.

Mejor jueguen otros de los juegos que hay por ah√≠, el mismo paladins o team fortress 2 que son los mas parecidos son mas divertidos, y tienen unas comunidades mas copadas.

You know its bad when I want the old lootbox system back.
Great to finally see the game on Steam. One less game launcher to worry about.

Overwatch 2 exemplifies what happens when a game's course of development is overtaken by corporate greed rather than making a product that puts players first. The only reason this game exists as a sequel is so that Blizzard could backtrack on promises they had made for Overwatch 1 (such as never locking new heroes behind paywalls). The fact that when this game was released into beta, you could pay $40 to get the founder's pack and support its development, which for many people meant supporting the PvE content even though at that time Blizzard knew it would be scrapped, is downright criminal. The idea of Overwatch at its core is a fun game, and I know the people who work on making this game are good people who are truly passionate about what they do, but unfortunately, making money comes before making a good and balanced game. I cannot support this corrupt business model, and neither should you.

I have over 1,000 hours on this game from BNet, where this game was before coming to steam. There are so many wonderful things about this game. From the numerous play styles, to the art, to the plentiful amount of game modes to choose from. I've enjoyed playing this game from a competitive viewpoint, so when I say I wholeheartedly recommend this game, I say so from the stance of someone who has played multiplayer PVP for hours on end.

I 100% recognize the mismanagement of the transition from OW1 to OW2. I think that Blizzard messed up. However, I also think Overwatch never needed a story mode or any form of PVE. I recognize the value that there could have been and I understand how fun it might have turned out to be. That being said, the game is plenty of fun as is. Blizzard never should have promised something they wouldn't deliver, but they've started putting out content again (thankfully).

Don't play this for PvE. That's dumb. Play it for a good team based FPS.

Imagine paying for the game back in 2016 for $39.99, played everyday, seeing this game have a bright future, from small local tourneys, Apex, OW World Cup to OWL. Suddenly, late 2019, OW2 was announced, Old players was promised great things & PVE Content.

Late 2022, OW1 Shutdown, OW2 launched. Surprise! Its the same game with 1 new mode but! its FREE to Play with $$ "micro"transactions Battle pass, Single overpriced skin cost $15~!(Kiriko OnePunchMan recolor was $21! imagine that) no PVE tho! We actually didn't work on it for the last 2 years!.
  
Aug 2023, PVE finally here?whats this? you have to pay for PVE? for just $14.99!

OG players paid $40+ for this game, played for years and was given nothing besides being able to keep old skins which  everyone are able to get now. So whats the point?.
